headline: Easy Gluten-Free Macaroni and Cheese
description: This gluten-free mac and cheese recipe is deliciously creamy with a crunchy crumb topping; perfect for a family-pleasing meal any night of the week.
name: Easy Gluten-Free Macaroni and Cheese
recipeIngredient: 2 gluten-free bread slices, toasted and broken into crumbs

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, 8 minutes. Drain.
Melt 1/4 cup butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir salt and mustard powder into melted butter; remove from heat and set aside.

Whisk milk and cornstarch together in a bowl until smooth; stir into butter mixture until well blended. Return saucepan to stove; cook milk mixture, stirring constantly, over medium heat until sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat.
Stir 3 cups Cheddar cheese into sauce until the heat from sauce melts cheese. Add pasta to cheese sauce and stir well; pour into the prepared baking dish.
Combine remaining 1 cup Cheddar cheese, gluten-free bread crumbs, 1 teaspoon butter, and paprika in a bowl; sprinkle over pasta mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until top is crunchy, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: After reading reviews, I was sure to stir the sauce even more than listed in instructions. Used a cheese combination of sharp cheddar, Asiago and Gouda. Added a generous amount pasta specific seasoning blend. Finally, added bacon to the topping instead of bread crumbs. Very tasty, although not as smooth and creamy as I was craving. Should I have stirred the sauce even more to alleviate the grainy texture?
Made exactly as listed but then also added some ground Turkey. This was delish and the kids loved it
Very good, but could have used just a bit more seasoning.

Easy and delicious! Make sure you let the cornstarch/milk mix heat long enough to get thick. I use oat milk and it requires more time than listed here. If you can be patient you will be amazed and the creamy sauce. I always use a combo of the cheeses I have left in my fridge. usually cheddar, swiss, moz... I was SO happy to find this GF recipe that the whole family enjoys.

Wonderful basic recipe great starting point for personalized touch. I used some hatch green chili gluten free pasta, panchetta and chopped medium onion with red pepper flakes. Swiss cheese with jalapeno Monterey jackcheese. Proportions were perfect. If yours turned out soopy, you didn't thicken the sauce long enough on the stove top. Mine has a generous course ground black pepper on top.

My son was recently diagnosed with celiac‘s and I was searching for a mac & cheese recipe to bring to a bbq. Luckily, I found this one! After reading the reviews mentioning the many dishes used I ended up using the pot I made the pasta in to melt the butter. Mixed the milk and cornstarch in another bowl and added to the pot. So I really only dirtied 2 dishes. Anyway I used 12 oz signature brand elbows from Safeway. Only boiled for about 5 min, so they were soft but still a bite to them. (They cook more in the oven.) Didn’t have mustard powder so I used garlic powder. 4 cups of milk was perfect. Used gluten-free breadcrumbs to sprinkle on top with a little paprika. Big hit and nobody could tell it was GF. Thank you for the recipe this one is definitely a keeper!

This was awesome! I changed a couple thing. I used a box of elbow pasta that was 12oz. not 10oz. I didn’t divide the cheese when making the cheese sauce mixture. Just added all 4 cups. I used an extra cup of cheese ?for the topping without the butter and bread crumbs.
We made for the first time and made it as-is and this recipe is a keeper. I'm not GF, but loved it.

This is an excellent basic recipe, lending itself to improvisation and augmentation.

I think the people complaining that it came out soupy didn't prepare the bechamel base properly - it took longer than 5 min on a higher temp to thicken. 

I think in the future, I'm going to try using different cheeses, and more seasonings. I added garlic and onion powder based on other comments here, but it could use even more, imo.

Still, great base recipe, and super easy to make.

I made this for thanksgiving and it was a hit!! Everyone kept asking for the recipe! Based on what some other reviewers said after I drained my pasta I rinsed it with cold water to keep it from cooking. It was perfect!
Was a hit with the whole family.

I found it took about 15 minutes for the sauce to thicken. After it thickened, I tempered two lightly beaten eggs and added them to the sauce, stirring them until incorporated. 
As others mentioned, I took care to leave the pasta al dente. The dish was perfectly done, with a crunchy top and creamy interior. I like mac and cheese with the eggs added; they add a light stability to the final product.

I found it took about 15 minutes for the sauce to thicken. After it thickened, I tempered two lightly beaten eggs and added them to the sauce, stirring them until incorporated. 
As others mentioned, I took care to leave the pasta al dente. The dish was perfectly done, with a crunchy top and creamy interior. I like mac and cheese with the eggs added; they add a light stability to the final product.
I’ve made it several times Really enjoyed it.

I was anxious making this for Christmas but I read some tips about gf pasta and the large amount of liquid seemed appropriate- so I followed the recipe exactly and it was delicious. I used rotini gf elbows and I think I only cooked them 5 minutes. Topped the macaroni with shredded cheese and baked it- definitely a success.

After adding the cheese sauce to the pasta, I, too, found that there was way more sauce than needed. Fortunately, my husband suggested I use a baster to siphon off the extra sauce, which I added to some pasta I had left over from chili I had made. 
 I added sautéed onion and well-drained, diced, fire roasted tomatoes to the mac and cheese and it was a huge hit at the potluck I brought it to. I used Rotini corn and rice pasta and cooked it for 6 minutes instead of 8 and it held up beautifully through the baking process.
It was good, but needs to be creamier! More milk is needed in the recipe.

First time making this and made a half batch. It has good flavor but excepted it to be creamy and it was a little mushy. Next time I will cook the pasta al denta and a little less time in the oven. But the kids liked it so it is a keeper.
This recipe is easy to follow and delicious!
Loved it as is. With two gluten free family members I am always searching for good GF versions of classics. This one did not disappoint!

This recipe is a keeper! I only reason I gave it a 4 and not a 5 was because it lacked a little creaminess. I stirred in 4 oz of cream cheese and it was wonderful!!!! Better than other recipes that use flour! The whole dish was devoured!

I made this for our youth group meal. Most of the group are very picky eaters, but this mac and cheese got rave reviews and seconds for most. No one knew it was GF. I made it as directed except used crushed potato chips in place of bread crumbs.
No one was concerned about it being Gluten-free! A big hit, and requested for the next dinner.
what a cheesy delicious hit!
Make it againhigh five
I used 100% gluten-free organic elbow macaroni imported from Italy - much better taste and appearance than the Barilla gluten-free that someone suggested.
I've made is a couple times baked, but have since found the correct cheese to pasta proportion to eat is unbaked. Only make half the cheese sauce and cook the pasta fully.
My family loved this!
Made this for a friend going through chemo. She says this is the best M&C she's ever had!
Great recipe! This is now my go to homemade Mac and cheese recipe!! I didn’t do the optional topping, I just sprinkled shredded cheese and paprika on top. Delicious!
I think 4 cups of milk was too much. Mine just turned into a soupy mess.

Made this for my sister-in-law who's GF. It was amazing! I'll make this from now on, maybe not with GF pasta, since we eat gluten! It was super, super easy. I didn't have GF bread to make the crumbs, and it was fine without it. Thank you!

I made it with penne and pre-made gluten-free breadcrumbs. It seemed a bit liquidy. If I make it again with penne, I'm going to use more noodles, and maybe more breadcrumbs on top. The addition of bacon bits and caramelized onions sounds like a great idea, too!

Excellent, easy recipe for someone that used to make the boxed stuff most of the time. From scratch was too long and too much. I halved this recipe (as the main dish for two servings) and it was so easy! I made it in my cast iron skillet... melted the butter, added the salt (omitted the mustard powder) and per other reviewers I reduced the milk to 1 1/2 cups from the listed two cups (half of the recipe.) Added 1 1/2 tablespoons of corn starch to the milk, whisked and poured in the skillet. Took less than a minute for it to thicken, probably because the skillet was already hot. Added some onion powder and paprika and 1 1/2 cups of sharp cheddar (saving the other 1/2 for the top.) Sprinkled with just a little bit of paprika and put in the oven. Took less than 8 minutes to get ready to go in the oven and only 20 minutes to bake (convection) so super quick! Didn't use any toppings other than the cheese, but I plan on making this for Thanksgiving in a bigger stainless steel skillet and I will put the cheese in the middle and surround that with crushed plain potato chips. Sure to be a hit!
Easy and delicious. I skipped the breadcrumbs and added the paprika directly to the recipe.
I made this and it turned out amazing. My company didn't even realize it was gluten free. I swapped out the mustard powder for garlic powder

We have a family of six, so I multiplied the recipe times 1 1/2. It worked fine. I also used gluten free bread crumbs instead of the toast and omitted the mustard powder and paprika. The entire family loved it! You could not even tell it was gluten free. It was an easy and delicious dish for all!!!
This was super easy to make and even my gluten family members enjoyed it! We loved this one.

I would give it 4 1/2 stars if possible. More the inexperience of the cook (me) than the recipe itself is why I can't give it another star. Even with that it came out quite good - I was actually surprised. I would make it again.
I will not use the dry mustard next time.

Very tasty and will serve as a good springboard for me to tweak. I think there was too much butter in the sauce, and will use less milk so that the bottom of the mac and cheese browns up a bit. Took way more than 5 minutes for the sauce to thicken. Overall, though, really good!!
Made as posted - my grandson who is celiac really enjoyed this recipe.

This was delicious. I did add MacLarens sharp cheese to the recipe to make up some of the cheese in the main dish and also some worchestershire sauce (1 1/2 tsp.) I will definitely make this again. Everyone loved it.

The cooking/prep time is accurate if you set out all of your ingredients. I used Barilla Gluten Free Elbows (the best GF pasta in my opinion). Will definitely be making it again and may be adding bacon bits, onions, and tomatoes just to change it up. Still delicious as-is! Highly recommend.
It took me over an hour and another twenty minutes in dishes. Would not reccomend.

Delicious! I followed the recipe with a small exception; I used GF bread crumbs in the topping. I made it for our family Christmas lunch for my cousin who is gluten intolerant. I ate it as well and it was as good as our regular mac and cheese. This is definitely a keeper.

Great exactly as posted. Made some changes the second time I made it based on my family's preferences. Cooked bacon with onions & jalapeño with a little molasses to carmalize. Also used a combination of cheddar, Colby, jack and cream cheese. And put crushed potatoe chips on top. Amazing! My hubby is not a fan of Mac and cheese or gluten free but he went back for seconds! Thanks for an awesome recipe!

This is a nice mac'n cheese.I opted for the bread crumb/paprika addition and am glad I did. It really sets it apart from the regular taste. I was worried about cooking the pasta first and then baking it knowing that GF pasta tends to turn to mush after overcooking. It didn't. It held up and was whole when I put my fork into it. I did cook it al dente though, this is an important step. I felt 190°C was too high though. I turned it down to 180°C about 5 minutes into the baking process and left it in for the thirty minutes. It was nice and crunchy on top and oozy-gooey in the middle. I wouldn't call this super easy though. It dirties up a lot of dishes and requires more work than what I consider super easy. It is quite tasty though so it is definitely worth the effort. Thank you kokodiablo for the recipe.
